thread.title: Spotless swings to profit | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The
thread.title_full: Spotless swings to profit | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The Advertiser

author: JOHN CONROY
title: Spotless swings to profit | Business News | Business and Finance News | | The
text:
Spotless Group has swung to a profit and says it expects to improve on the results again in the coming year.
The cleaning and catering company recorded a statutory profit of $142.8 million in the 12 months to June 30 against the previous year's $34.7m net loss, which included costs related to the company's restructuring and initial public offering.
Revenue lifted 9.6 per cent to $2.87 billion over the period.
Spotless said net profit rose 34 per cent on a pro forma basis, with the results exceeding its prospectus forecasts
“Spotless continues to demonstrate its ability to grow revenues and capitalise on an impressive pipeline of tender opportunities in the market," Spotless chairman Margaret Jackson said.
"During the year, we were successful in securing a number of major facilities management and multi-service contracts, adding to our stable long-term client base.”
Spotless announced a final dividend of 5.5c, unfranked, for a total dividend of 10c, unfranked - down from 23.529c in the year prior. The dividend is payable on September 25 for shareholders on the register at September 4.
The company said it had build a "strong growth platform" from five acquisitions announced during the year.
"Subject to economic conditions, we expect the FY16 results to materially exceed the FY15 results," the company wrote in its earnings report.
Chief executive Bruce Dixon said Spotless was well placed to take advantage of consolidation opportunities in the services sector, "where we believe we can create value for our clients and deliver returns to our shareholders.
"This will continue to be a focus for the team in 2016," he said.
The Australian
Originally published as Spotless swings to profit
